level.heading: Maximum Amount of Benefits and Contributions.

level.text: Benefits and contributions under the provisions of this subchapter shall not be computed with reference to any compensation that exceeds that maximum dollar amount permitted by section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as adjusted for increases in the cost-of-living. This provision shall take effect as of October 1, 2002, and shall apply only with respect to an individual who first becomes covered by this subchapter after that date.

Benefits shall not be payable under this subchapter to the extent that they exceed the limitations imposed by section 415 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as adjusted for increases in the cost-of-living.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 15-105, in subsecs. (a) and (b), validated previously made technical corrections.

level.heading: References in Text
level.text: Section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, referred to in par. (1), is classified as 26 U.S.C.A. § 401(a)(17).
Section 415 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, referred to in par. (2), is classified as 26 U.S.C.A. § 415.

level.heading: Miscellaneous Notes
level.text: Section 3723 of D.C. Law 14-190 provides: "This subtitle [subtitle B of title XXXVII, §§ 3721 to 3724, of D.C. Law 14-190] shall apply as of January 1, 2002."
